text: Specific CpG sites in the <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter are methylated in hematopoietic cells

In order to exactly map the methylation sites within the <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter , we treated DNA of Jurkat , CML-T1 , U-937 , K-562 and EM-2 cells as well as of SD-1 , RPMI-8226 and BV-173 control cells with bisulfite , which chemically converts unmethylated cytosine to uracil , whereas it has no effect on methylated cytosine , i.e . in CpG ( 34 ) .
This technique is especially useful for detection of unknown methylation patterns .
PCR amplification , cloning and sequencing of the bisulfite-treated DNA showed a specific methylation pattern of the analyzed 62 CpG sites in all cell lines ( Figure 4 and Table 1 ) .

In general , the methylational status ranged from one cell line with a nearly non-methylated <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter ( SD-1 , <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - positive ) to a completely methylated <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter in CML-T1 ( <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - negative ) .

text: Interestingly , the percentage of CpG methylation in the <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter from <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - positive cells was very low ( mean 24 % ) as compared with <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - negative cells ( mean 94 % ) ( Figure 4A and Table 1 ) .

text: A 5'-region ( R1 ) with 13 hypermethylated CpG sites ( mean number of methylated clones 5.5 of 8 with 77 % methylated CpGs ) was found in most cells ( except SD-1 and RPMI-8226 ) and a 3'-region ( R3 ) of 6 hypomethylated CpG sites ( mean number of methylated clones 1.7 of 8 with 33 % methylated CpGs ) was found in most cells ( except CML-T1 and U-937 ) ( Figure 4A and Table 1 ) .

Intriguingly , a stretch of 13 CpG sites ( # 10-22 ; R2 ) was detected in between these regions , which were highly methylated in <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - negative ( mean number of methylated clones 7.1 of 8 with 89 % methylated CpGs ) but totally non-methylated in <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - positive cells ( Figure 4A and B ) .

text: Furthermore , three CpG sites at the 5 ' end ( # 54 , 56 , 58 ) and two CpG motifs at the 3 ' end ( # 1 , 2 ) showed this direct correlation between high methylation status and absence of <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .

text: In addition , two CpG sites located in a NFkappaB ( # 48 ) and a SP1 element ( # 45 ) are less methylated in <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - positive than in <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - negative cells ( mean number of methylated clones : 1 / 8 versus 8 / 8 ) .

text: These results indicate the involvement of CpG methylation in the regulation of <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in leukemic cells .
